alert.note: Alert for Dewey; Hughes; Jones; Lyman; Stanley; Sully (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Extreme Fire Danger issued September 08 at 3:19AM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: .DISCUSSION... Another day of hot and dry conditions is expected today. Minimum relative humidity values will be around 20 to 25 percent across much of central South Dakota, with 25 to 35 percent values across the rest of the area. A cold front will move from west to east across the area as well, leading to a wind shift from southerly to northwesterly during the morning and early afternoon. Winds will be breezy, with gusts of 25 to 30 mph. Rain chances will begin to increase late Thursday night into Friday with some scattered showers and storms possible. Much cooler air moves in Friday as well. ...EXTREME FIRE DANGER... Extreme weather conditions and very low moisture content of grasses, and other dry organic material on the ground, indicate that critical burning conditions exist. All fires have the potential to become large and spread quickly becoming erratic with extreme behavioral characteristics. The outlook for Friday afternoon...The grassland fire danger index will reach the moderate category.

area.areaDesc: Dewey; Hughes; Jones; Lyman; Stanley; Sully
